# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the code you need to write the function:
```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return lowercase(strip(col)) |> replace(" ", "_") |> replace("-", "_")
end
```
This function takes a string column name as input, and returns a new string with the same text but in lowercase, stripped of any leading or trailing whitespaces, and with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.

You can test this function with different inputs to make sure it works correctly:
```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("  my-column  ")
"my_column"
```
